meanings.definition: The act of killing a person unlawfully but not with malice aforethought.
meanings.sent1: The manslaughters of the innocent victims deeply saddened the community.
meanings.sent2: The manslaughters in the city have increased over the past year.
meanings.sent3: The manslaughters at the clown convention were all accidental pie-throwing incidents.
meanings.sent4: The manslaughters of trust within the team led to its downfall.
meanings.sent5: The manslaughters of hope left a trail of despair in their wake.

meanings.definition: To kill (a person) unlawfully but not with malice aforethought.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally manslaughters the deer while hunting.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was charged with manslaughtering the victim in a fit of rage.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly manslaughters her alarm clock every morning by hitting snooze multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The virus silently manslaughters the body's immune system.
meanings.sent5: The storm manslaughters the fragile sandcastle on the beach.
